node_content Module

This module containing base class for Node’s content graphical representation. It also contains example of overriden Text Widget which can pass to it’s parent notification about currently being modified.

class GUI.node_content.NodeContentWidget(node, parent=None)

Bases: QWidget, Serializable

Base class: Node’s graphics content. This class also provides layout for other widgets inside of NodeConfig class

Parameters:

  • node (NodeConfig) – reference to NodeConfig

  • parent (QtWidgets.QWidget) – parent widget

initUI()

Default layout setup and widgets to be rendered in NodeGraphics class

addWidgetToLayout(widgets=[], height=20)

Let content create default layout configuration

setEditingFlag(value)

Helper function which sets editingFlag inside GraphicsView class

This is a helper function to handle editing node’s content with QLineEdits or QTextEdits (use overriden :py:classs:TextEditOverride) and handle keyPressEvent inside GraphicsView class.

Note

If you are handling KeyPress events by default Qt Window’s shortcuts and QActions, you can ignore this method

Parameters:

value (bool) – new value for editing flag

serialize()

Serialization method to serialize this class data into OrderedDict which can be easily stored in memory or file.

Returns:

data serialized in OrderedDict

Return type:

OrderedDict

deserialize(data, hashmap={}, restore_id=True)

Deserialization method which take data in python dict format with helping hashmap containing references to existing entities.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Dictionary containing serialized data

  • hashmap (dict) – Helper dictionary containing references (by id == key) to existing objects

  • restore_id (bool) – True if we are creating new Sockets. False is useful when loading existing Sockets of which we want to keep the existing object’s id.

Returns:

True if deserialization was successful, otherwise False

Return type:

bool

staticMetaObject = <PySide2.QtCore.QMetaObject object>
class GUI.node_content.TextEditOverride

Bases: QTextEdit

Overriden QTextEdit which sends notification about being edited to parent widget NodeContentWidget

Note

This class is example of QTextEdit modification to be able to handle Delete key with overriden Qt’s keyPressEvent (when not using QActions in menu or toolbar)

focusInEvent(event)

Example of overriden focusInEvent to mark the start of editing

Parameters:

event (QFocusEvent) – Qt’s focus event

focusOutEvent(event)

Example of overriden focusOutEvent to mark the end of editing

Parameters:

event (QFocusEvent) – Qt’s focus event

staticMetaObject = <PySide2.QtCore.QMetaObject object>
